meanings.definition: The outer layer of bread or pastry.
meanings.sent1: She always eats the crust of her sandwich first.
meanings.sent2: The pizza crust was crispy and delicious.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the crust of the pie was the best part.
meanings.sent4: The crust of the bread held all the toppings together like a sturdy wall.
meanings.sent5: The crust of the pie crumbled easily in her hands.

meanings.definition: A hard outer layer or covering.
meanings.sent1: The thick crust of ice made it hard to walk on the frozen lake.
meanings.sent2: The crust of the earth is made up of different layers.
meanings.sent3: The crust of the old book was cracked and worn from years of use.
meanings.sent4: The crust of the volcano was solid and unyielding.
meanings.sent5: The crust of the pie was so tough, it was difficult to cut through.

meanings.sent1: Scientists study the crust to learn more about the Earth's history.
meanings.sent2: The crust is where we find the continents and oceans.
meanings.sent3: The crust of the Earth is like a protective shell around the planet.
meanings.sent4: Exploring the depths of the ocean is like peeling back the layers of the Earth's crust.
meanings.sent5: The crust of the Earth is constantly shifting and changing.
